document.docAuthor: Dardón, María José, Torres, Félix & Ornosa, Concepción
document.masterDocTitle: The subgenus Andrena (Micrandrena) (Hymenoptera: Andrenidae) in the Iberian Peninsula

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The subgenus Andrena (Micrandrena) (Hymenoptera: Andrenidae) in the Iberian Peninsula

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Andrena nigrifrons
Smith 1855
: 97
(nec
Eversmann 1852
, nec
Smith 1853
)

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Individuals of this species are characterized by a scutum and scutellum with clear and dense PPs, E= 1 , while on the metasomal terga they are intermingled between the microsculptures. The marginal zones are not marked, and occupy approximately 0.5 times the length of the terga. The propodeal triangle is defined and has rough ornamentation on the basal region. The posterior zone of the propodeum has fine ornamentation, and the penis valve of the male genitalia is not elongated.
